FacilityName: Helena Agri-Enterprises, LLC - Casey, IL Facility

_prev_prog_2.MH_OtherType: Vehicle or Projectile Strike, Vandalism, Theft, or Terrorism
_prev_prog_2.PC_OtherType: Electronic actuated emergency shutoff valves and internal valves
_prev_prog_2.CH_OtherChanges: The Facility has removed its rail spur and is in the process of completly re-plumbing the process to meet all ANSI and State of Illinois requirements.
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Pressure vessels; process piping, pumps, valves, and transfer hoses
_prev_prog_2.Description:
The Warehouse Manager implements the Risk Management Plan (RMP) and Risk Management Program (RMPr) for the Storage & Handling of anhydrous ammonia at this facility and is assisted by other Helena staff as directed. The Risk Management Program includes an Accident Prevention Program that includes Safety Information, Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Maintenance, Compliance Audits, and Incident Investigation. Equipment included under this covered process includes (1) three 30,000-gallon stationary pressure vessels and ancillary pumps, piping, and valves, (2) 34 1,450-gallon nurse tanks, and (3) 41 1,000-gallon nurse tanks.  Helena personnel perform the transfer of anhydrous ammonia from the pressure vessels to the nurse tanks in accordance with the Operating Procedures provided in the RMPr.



Helena receives anhydrous ammonia by a Contractor that transports the anhydrous ammonia with a commercial tanker truck. The commercial tanker truck is temporarily parked on the Facility property while the anhydrous ammonia is transferred to the on-site pressure vessels. The transfer process from the commercial truck is performed by the commercial tanker truck operator (Contractor). Helena does not own or operate the commercial tanker truck. The Contractor is responsible to Helena for complying with relevant operation, maintenance, and training procedures and documentation. At a minimum, the Contractor must (1) have in place and certify compliance with applicable and relevant DOT and OSHA regulations, (2) make available to Helena and EPA upon request any contractor-related documentation necessary to demonstrate compliance, and (3) certify that it has in place emergency shut-down procedures for ammonia unloading operations and that its OSHA and DOT programs comply with federal, state, and local regulatory requirements. Further, Helena will provide a copy of its Contingency Plan and RMPr for review upon request by the Contractor.

_emerg_resp.FR_OtherRegulation: This is a non-responding facility and it coordinates its response activities with the LEPC and local Fire Department. Notification information and procedures are provided in its Contingency Plan.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



The Casey Facility has submitted this updated electronic RMP in compliance with the provisions of the Clean Air Act 112 (r) as codified by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency at 40 CFR Part 68. Standards codified by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration at 29 CFR 1910.119 are not applicable to the operations at this facility because the facility is operated as a retail operation and is exempt from the OSHA standards.  However, the OSHA standards at 29 CFR 1910.111, Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, are applicable and are included in the Risk Management Program (RMPr) document that is implemented by this Facility.



This electronic submittal provides conservative estimates of the offsite consequences of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia from the Casey Facility located on the west end of Casey at 601 West Main Street, Casey, IL 62420.  The electronic RMP summarizes the policies and procedures implemented by the Casey Facility to minimize the likelihood of an accident.  The electronic RMP also summarizes the actions that the Casey Facility has taken to ensure that a response to a release will be implemented in a proper and timely manner.



PURPOSE FOR UPDATING RMP



Helena has updated the RMP to report to show a change in the nurse tank inventory.  



FACILITY



The Casey Facility is a retail agricultural chemical facility and operates one (1) covered process that includes Storage and Handling of anhydrous ammonia.  Anhydrous ammonia is transported to the Facility via a commercial tanker truck and then transferred to one of three (3) 30,000-gallon stationary pressure vessels.  The commercial tanker truck operator (Contractor) performs these transfer operations.  



Helena stores the anhydrous ammonia in the on-site stationary pressure vessels and then transfers the anhydrous ammonia from the pressure vessels to nurse tanks at point of retail sale to the end user (e.g. the farmer).  This Facility owns and ope

rates 34 1,450-gallon nurse tanks and 41 1,000-gallon nurse tanks.  Helena performs this operation in accordance with its RMPr accident prevention program.  





OFF-SITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS



Worst case and alternative case consequence analyses were completed for the storage and handling process.  The worst case scenario release for the Retail Facility assumed that all the contents in the largest single pressure vessel were released. The release was modeled as if the pressure vessel was punctured on the side at the ground level. The resulting release of ammonia was modeled as a ground level horizontal jet. 



The alternative (or more likely to occur) scenario assumes a rupture of a 2-inch transfer hose caused by an impact from a vehicle or some other source during a major loading or unloading operation. This alternative scenario also considers active mitigation of the safety equipment (i.e. emergency shutoff and excess flow valves on the commercial tanker truck; and back flow check valves, emergency shutoff, and excess flow valves on the pressure vessel side of the bulkhead), and operating procedures that the Facility uses to safeguard against releases from ammonia transfer operations.



ACCIDENT PREVENTION PROGRAM



The Warehouse Manager implements the risk management planning process at this Facility.  The Warehouse is assisted by other Helena staff, as directed.  The Warehouse Manager is responsible for ensuring that Helena Staff are properly trained in the implementation of the Prevention Program which includes Safety Information, Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Maintenance, Compliance Audits, Incident Investigations, and Emergency Contingency Plans.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Helena's Casey Facility is a non-responding facility. Helena has coordinated emergency response activities with its local emergency response agency and local fire department.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no on-site deaths, injuries, or sign

ificant property damage; or off-site deaths, injuries, property damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place, in the past five (5) years because of the ammonia operations at the Casey Facility.



CONCLUSION



The Risk Management Plan implemented by the Casey Facility complies with the requirements of the Clean Air Act, Section 112(r). The RMP will be updated as the Casey Facility adds, deletes, or changes processes. The Emergency Response Program has been coordinated with the Cumberland County LEPC and Casey Fire Department.



NOTE: Sections 4, 5, 6, and 7 of the standard RMP produced by EPA's RMP Submit Program are not applicable to the Casey Facility.
